results.title: The Dust bowl
results.creator_credit: Mel Stuart, Burton Benjamin and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Contrasts past and present conditions of the Dust Bowl area of the Southern Great Plains. Provides newsreel footage of the area during the dust storms period of the early 1930s. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Durga puja in Calcutta
results.creator_credit: Mriganka Sekhar Ray and Calcutta Film Society
results.brief_description: The monsoon is over…in Bengal it is time for the festival of Durga Puja, goddess of war, militant aspect of Parvati, consort of Shiva. Celebrations praise Durga’s victory over the buffalo demon Mahisasura symbolising triumph of good over evil. The film is an impressionistic view of this festival.

results.title: Duntroon [Short version]: the Royal Military College of Australia
results.brief_description: An account of the training of cadet officers at Australia’s military college, Duntroon. In the academic field there are three courses open - general science, engineering, and arts. Duntroon has become famous for its parade ground efficiency and its traditions of loyalty, efficiency and responsibility. Narrated by Keith Eden and photography by Arthur Brown.

results.title: Duntroon: the Royal Military College of Australia [Long version]
results.brief_description: An account of the training of cadet officers at Australia’s military college. In the academic field, there are three courses open - general science, engineering, and arts. Life at the College is shown, including facilities for recreation; rooms for chess and music enthusiasts; clubs, a dance band and an amateur radio station. Duntroon has become famous for its parade ground efficiency and its traditions of loyalty, efficiency and responsibility. Narrated by Keith Eden, photography by Arthur Brown.

Duntroon has become famous for its parade ground efficiency and its traditions of loyalty, efficiency and responsibility. Narrated by Keith Eden, photography by Arthur Brown.

results.title: Arou
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
In this film, a map locates Arou, a tribal area of the Duna people, in the New Guinea highlands between the Central and Muller Ranges. The traditional economy of the people is shown to be almost self-sufficient. Sweet potatoes are the staple food and pigs are the main form of wealth. The lifting of entry restrictions in 1964 allowed European contact to be made with these people and the resulting changes in the economy and some problems now facing the Duna people are revealed. Suitable for Social Studies and Geography. No other credits available.

results.title: The Dumping grounds
results.creator_credit: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at the issue of the makeshift Bantu reservations to which the South African Government is transporting whole communities in furtherance of its “separate development” policy. Reveals an appalling catalogue of mismanagement and neglect on the part of those responsible for this mass transportation of people - and on the Bantu side a total crushing despair.

results.title: Duke Ellington at the White House
results.brief_description: A special guest performance of this world famous jazz man at the White House is captured in this film. Duke Ellington plays before distinguished guests and displays his great talent in what was virtually a ‘command performance’.
results.description: A special guest performance of this world famous jazz man at the White House is captured in this film. Duke Ellington plays before distinguished guests and displays his great talent in what was virtually a ‘command performance’.

results.title: Dues and the union
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The importance of the regular payment of union dues and how they keep a union going is told through the story of a young pipefitter. New to the trade and to his responsibilities as a union member, Frank Weston found there was much to learn about both. Fortunately for him, his boss on the job - a skilled tradesman and a founder of the union - had the patience to teach him. Through him Frank learns the significance of prompt dues payment and the services provided by them, and comes to enjoy the satisfaction of active and interested union membership.

results.title: Ducks, of course
results.creator_credit: John Howe, William H. Carrick, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: That one duck is not necessarily the same as another is made clear in this film, which has as its objective the protection of the dwindling species. The star of the film is a hunter who is obviously light on duck lore but heavy on the trigger. By the time everything has been made clear, he (and the viewer) knows a good deal more about duck identification.
